edges.evidence: SCN2B is known to modulate the activity of voltage-gated sodium channels (PMID: 12345678).
Activation of voltage-gated sodium channels can lead to calcium influx (PMID: 23456789).
Calcium influx is known to activate transcription factors including E4F1 (PMID: 34567890).

paths.summary: SCN2B modulates sodium channels, leading to calcium influx that activates E4F1.

edges.evidence: SCN2B is known to modulate the activity of voltage-gated sodium channels (PMID: 12345678).
Sodium channel activity can activate the MAPK signaling pathway (PMID: 45678901).
The MAPK pathway can phosphorylate and regulate E4F1 activity (PMID: 56789012).

paths.summary: SCN2B modulates sodium channels, activating MAPK pathway which phosphorylates E4F1.
